name: undelivered
content:
undelivered adjective
(LETTER)
Add to word list
Add to word list
An undelivered letter, parcel, or message has not been delivered or cannot be delivered: We spend millions trying to return undelivered mail that is not properly addressed. The airline's baggage problem arose last week after technical faults resulted in 7,000 bags being undelivered.
More examplesFewer examplesCustomers complained that thousands of letters remained undelivered.The letter had been returned undelivered.The email marketing industry will waste US$138 million on undelivered emails.

undelivered adjective
(PROMISE)
If something that was promised or planned is undelivered, it has not been done: The vendor has been making undelivered promises since before shipment. It was not the only undelivered element of the company's obligations.
More examplesFewer examplesEarly promises have gone undelivered again.This is a promise which has gone undelivered for generations.The proposal could form part of a bill promised by government at the general election, but as yet undelivered.
